page.title: 04OTHER ENTERPRISES
page.content: Both barley and wheat are grown, mainly sold for processing into animal feed.Most crops are winter sown, although some spring barley is grown. The 16 hectare horticultural holding grows soft fruit and salad crops. The salad crops of tomatoes, cucumbers and lettuce are grown under glass and sold in the seasonal farm shop and through local retail outlets. Although some of the soft fruit is picked and sold to local retailers most is harvested and sold on a "pick- your-own" basis.Soft fruits grown include strawberries,raspberries,black currants,gooseberries and loganberries The beef enterprises vary from 50 head of cattle reared to fat cattle, through 16 reared and sold at 12 mnth. old as store cattle,down to a few head kept on paddocks to utilise excess grass belonging to residential houses.
